metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12426 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 77. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 78.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12426` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
